meanings.definition: Protected from a disease or the like, as by inoculation.
meanings.sent1: The vaccinated children were immune to the flu.
meanings.sent2: She seemed immune to the cold weather, never needing a jacket.
meanings.sent3: The superhero was so immune to harm that even falling from a great height didn't faze him.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude acted like an immune shield against negativity.
meanings.sent5: The fortress was immune to enemy attacks, standing strong and impenetrable.
